com.revature.repository

Interface UserRepository

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<User,java.lang.Integer>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<User,java.lang.Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<User,java.lang.Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<User>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<User,java.lang.Integer>

public interface UserRepository
extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<User,java.lang.Integer>

      • getRankByUserNameOrderByPoints

        @Query(value="with ordered as (select username, points, rank () over (order by points desc) ranks from users) select ranks, username, points from ordered where username =?1",
       nativeQuery=true)
java.lang.Object getRankByUserNameOrderByPoints(java.lang.String username)
        Returns an object that contains the user's rank in the leader board, name, and points.

        This method is the called by the userService and is used for getting a single user's rank in the leader board. Uses a nativeQuery GetRanked which reads as the following: "with ordered as (select username, points, rank () over (order by points desc) ranks from users) select ranks, username, points from ordered where username =?1" Basically we want to order the table of user by their points, assign them a rank in that order, then select the user that was passed in and retrieve their rank, username, and points fields.

        Parameters:
        username - name of the user that the requester want the rank of.
        Returns:
        Returns an object that contains a user's rank in the leader board, name, and points.
